curam.util.administration.impl

Class FieldLevelSecurityAdmin

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.administration.base.FieldLevelSecurityAdmin
      • curam.util.administration.impl.FieldLevelSecurityAdmin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FieldLevelSecurityAdmin
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FieldLevelSecurityAdminFactory

    public abstract class FieldLevelSecurityAdmin
extends curam.util.administration.base.FieldLevelSecurityAdmin
    This class provides an interface for administrating Field Level Security. Field Level Security is the ability to secure particular fields displayed on a client screen from certain users.

        public FieldLevelSecurityAdmin()

    • Method Detail

      • setSidForReturnedField

        public void setSidForReturnedField(java.lang.String operationName,
                                   java.lang.String fieldName,
                                   java.lang.String sidName,
                                   int versionNo)
                            throws DatabaseException,
                                   AppException,
                                   InformationalException
        Set the Security Identifier (SID) for a specified return field on a particular client visible operation. An empty SID means the return field is not secured.
        Parameters:
        operationName - Contains the operation name.
        fieldName - Contains the field name of the return field.
        sidName - Contains the specified SID name to be associated with the field.
        versionNo - The version number for the optimistic locking mechanism.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        AppException - ID_SID_COULD_NOT_BE_SET - if the specified return field on the specified client visible operation could not be found.
        AppException - ID_RECORD_CHANGED - if target record has been modified and the optimistic locking was not successful.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
        See Also:
        FieldLevelSecurityAdmin.getSidForReturnedField(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

        public ReturnedFieldNameWrapperList getAllReturnedFieldsByOperation(java.lang.String operationName)
                                                             throws DatabaseException,
                                                                    AppException,
                                                                    InformationalException
        Gets all the return fields for a specified client visible operation.
        Parameters:
        operationName - Operation name.
        Returns:
        The return fields for the specified client visible operation.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • getAllReturnedFieldsAndSidsByOperation

        public ReturnedFieldAndSidDtlsList getAllReturnedFieldsAndSidsByOperation(java.lang.String operationName)
                                                                   throws DatabaseException,
                                                                          AppException,
                                                                          InformationalException
        Gets all the return fields and their associated Security Identifiers (SIDs) for a specified client visible operation. An empty SID means the return field is not secured.
        Parameters:
        operationName - Contains the operation name.
        Returns:
        all the return fields and their SIDs for the specified client visible operation.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • getSidForReturnedField

        public java.lang.String getSidForReturnedField(java.lang.String operationName,
                                               java.lang.String fieldName)
                                        throws DatabaseException,
                                               AppException,
                                               InformationalException
        Get the Security Identifier (SID) for a specified return field on a particular client visible operation. An empty SID means the return field is not secured.
        Parameters:
        operationName - Contains the operation name.
        fieldName - Contains the field name.
        Returns:
        The SID for the specified return field on the client visible operation, or null if the specified field does not exist.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        AppException - ID_INTERFACE_AND_RETURNED_FIELD_NOT_FOUND - if the specified client visible operation and return field cannot be found.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
        See Also:
        FieldLevelSecurityAdmin.setSidForReturnedField(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, int)

      • getSidVersionNoForReturnedField

        public SidNameVersionNoWrapperStruct getSidVersionNoForReturnedField(java.lang.String operationName,
                                                                     java.lang.String fieldName)
                                                              throws DatabaseException,
                                                                     AppException,
                                                                     InformationalException
        Get the Security Identifier (SID) and version number (required for optimistic locking) for a specified return field on a specified client visible operation. An empty SID means the return field is not secured.
        Parameters:
        operationName - Contains the operation name.
        fieldName - Contains the field name.
        Returns:
        A wrapper containing the SID and version number for the specified return field on the client visible operation, or null if the specified field does not exist.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        AppException - ID_INTERFACE_AND_RETURNED_FIELD_NOT_FOUND - if the specified client visible operation and return field cannot be found.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • addFieldForInterface

        public void addFieldForInterface(java.lang.String operationName,
                                 java.lang.String fieldName)
                          throws DatabaseException,
                                 AppException,
                                 InformationalException
        Add the supported meta-data that is required for a return field on a client visible operation. This return field is initially set to be unsecured. This information is pre-populated by the infrastructure as described in the Modelling Guide, however this interface allows for a run-time administrative client to update the information without direct access to the database.
        Parameters:
        operationName - Contains the operation name.
        fieldName - Contains the field name on the specified operation. If this already exists no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • getAllSecuredFields

        public FieldLevelSecurityDetailsList getAllSecuredFields()
                                                  throws DatabaseException,
                                                         AppException,
                                                         InformationalException
        Returns a list of the field level security details for those fields which are secured.
        Returns:
        A list of the field level security details.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Standard database exceptions.
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

      • getAllOperations

        public OperationNameList getAllOperations()
                                   throws DatabaseException,
                                          AppException,
                                          InformationalException
        Returns a list of all the operations which can have secured fields.
        Returns:
        A list of the operation names.
        Throws:
